main event: On May 7, 1957, one witness observed a round blue object the size of a dime in Randall, Iowa, through binoculars for half an hour. The object appeared to jump around and did not disappear.
interesting points: The sighting occurred at 6:15 AM local time., The witness described the object as round and blue, observed through binoculars., The object was visible for half an hour., There are speculations that the object might have been a large star or planet., The conclusion of the report indicates the sighting was likely of astronomical nature, possibly a comet.
witness description: One individual who observed the object through binoculars.
